text: Boko Haram on the rampage earlier this
year in Northeast Nigeria for the past
week the Islamist extremists have been
terrorizing villages in gwoza near the
Cameroonian border there are reports of
hundreds dead those that could headed to
these Mandurah mountains Boko Haram
fighters chasing and shooting them as
they fled I got through to a man who
witnessed the recent attack on his
village at agarra from the mountain he
told me homes were still on fire what
happened to the dead people have they
been buried in shallow graves can you
see any soldiers Nigeria's military
flying over the sambisa forest where
Boko Haram has bases it's where the more
than 200 schoolgirls were initially
taken after being abducted eight weeks
ago this is what remains of their
boarding school the girls are still
missing
but these days Groza too has become a
book or Haram stronghold people from
gwoza
get the latest information from their
relatives back home in the villages that
Boko Haram has been attacking a lot of
black and white Flags installed would
Arabic writing on it indicating that
this is our headquarters we are in

again around have one or two flags
flying yes as of now what they believe
is that this place having curved out of
Nigeria the Nigerian military says it's

doesn't want to say much about the

what I know is whatever is or should be

he's been Donald who's been done in this

Ross BBC news Abuja
